articles.description: It comes after he faced criticism for sharing a social media post about Zionism.
articles.title: Match of the Day host Gary Lineker expected to leave the BBC

articles.description: Five teams into three places don't go - so who will qualify for the Champions League as the Premier League's race for Europe enters its final week?
articles.title: Premier League: Who will qualify for Champions League, Europa League and Conference League?

articles.description: World number one Scottie Scheffler holds off a rejuvenated Jon Rahm to convert his overnight lead into a maiden US PGA Championship title
articles.title: US PGA Championship 2025: Scottie Scheffler wins by six strokes after holding off Jon Rahm challenge

articles.description: Max Verstappen reminded everyone in Imola that he cannot be ruled out of the championship fight but the maths still favour McLaren, writes Andrew Benson.
articles.title: Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix: How Max Verstappen caught McLaren by surprise in Imola

articles.description: Sam Cook is in line for a long-awaited England debut on Thursday, but the night before his eyes will be on Manchester United, writes Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: Sam Cook: England's new seamer on Manchester United, DJing and Fred the tortoise

articles.description: Match of the Day pundit Martin Keown explains how Mikel Arteta's side can emulate his Arsenal team and take the next step to winning trophies.
articles.title: 'It can't all come from the manager' - Martin Keown on how Mikel Arteta's Arsenal can become winners

articles.description: Carlos Alcaraz ends world number one Jannik Sinner's 26-match winning streak with a 7-6 6-1 win in the Italian Open final.
articles.title: Italian Open results: Carlos Alcaraz beats Jannik Sinner in straight sets to win title

articles.description: Ajax held a nine-point lead at the end of March, but PSV Eindhoven pipped them to the Eredivisie title. Former midfielder Wim Jonk tells BBC Sport about how it all unfolded.
articles.title: A tale of nine points & the 99th minute - how Ajax blew the Eredivisie title

articles.description: England captain Harry Kane tells BBC Sport about winning his first trophy, life in Germany and thoughts on a Premier League return.
articles.title: Harry Kane: Bayern Munich title win 'was like a switch went off’

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says there are "lots of positives to take" from the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix after he finished fourth from 12th on the grid.
articles.title: Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton says 'more to come' from Ferrari
